Common.name: Roundhead (base)
Common.description: Matte black circular head, flat shadow base style
Common.compatibility_notes: Fully compatible with all eye and accessory types

Common.name: Knit Cap Dome
Common.description: Rounded head with texture resembling ribbed fabric
Common.compatibility_notes: Avoid bulky accessories that would obscure the cap

Common.name: Graffiti Dome
Common.description: Head covered in faint graffiti markings, no eyes

Common.name: Slick Chrome
Common.description: Gloss black with a single light reflection edge
Common.compatibility_notes: Avoid complex auras or reflectivity clashes

Common.name: Bandaged
Common.description: Wrapped in grungy street-style bandages, subtle tears
Common.compatibility_notes: Skip glasses or overlapping facial accessories

Common.name: Smooth Vinyl
Common.description: Shiny, dark vinyl surface with slight texture

Common.name: Popped Spray Can
Common.description: Head stylized as a can with nozzle top, minor dents

Common.name: Cone Cap
Common.description: Cone-shaped head like an upside-down traffic cone

Common.name: Dome with Sticker
Common.description: Basic round head with random sticker placement

Common.name: Tape-Wrapped
Common.description: Wrapped in street tape (e.g., caution or barcode tape)

Common.name: Blank White
Common.description: Solid white ovals, giving off a neutral or robotic stare
Common.compatibility_notes: Compatible with all head types, ideal for base characters

Common.name: Angled Glare
Common.description: Slightly narrowed eyes with attitude
Common.compatibility_notes: Avoid on heads without visible eye area

Common.name: Half-Lidded Chill
Common.description: Relaxed eyelids, communicates boredom or calmness
Common.compatibility_notes: Pairs well with bandaged or vinyl heads

Common.name: Dot Eyes
Common.description: Tiny centered dots, innocent or eerie effect
Common.compatibility_notes: Compatible with smooth and rounded heads

Common.name: One Eye Closed
Common.description: Classic wink, adds casual playfulness
Common.compatibility_notes: Avoid on heads with symmetry-based designs

Common.name: Oval Glow (Low)
Common.description: Dimly glowing white ovals
Common.compatibility_notes: Pairs with darker head textures like Chrome or Vinyl

Common.name: Sticker Eye
Common.description: One eye appears to be a slapped-on sticker

Common.name: Stitched Eyes
Common.description: Cross-stitch pattern where eyes should be
Common.compatibility_notes: Avoid with highly reflective head types

Common.name: Ghosted
Common.description: Eyes barely visible — faint outlines only

Common.name: Reflective Visor
Common.description: Thin horizontal visor with faint eye glint

Rare.name: Dual Glint
Rare.description: Eyes with a subtle twin sparkle, adds alertness and intensity
Rare.compatibility_notes: Works well with tech or skull head types

Rare.name: Eye Slash
Rare.description: One glowing eye with a digital slash trail across the face

Rare.name: Mono Lens
Rare.description: Cyclops-style single glowing lens
Rare.compatibility_notes: Ideal for mecha or helmet heads

Rare.name: Tag Scribble Eyes
Rare.description: Eyes drawn like graffiti tags
Rare.compatibility_notes: Best used with graffiti or bandaged domes

Rare.name: Scanline Eyes
Rare.description: Eyes rendered as horizontal scanlines
Rare.compatibility_notes: Avoid on masked or obscured face types

Rare.name: Broken Gaze
Rare.description: Glitch effect splits one eye into shards
Rare.compatibility_notes: Pairs with cracked or glitchy heads

Rare.name: Neon Outline
Rare.description: Eyes outlined in a glowing color (red, green, teal)

Rare.name: Hollow Ring Eyes
Rare.description: White rings for eyes with dark inner cores

Rare.name: Streaked Under-Eyes
Rare.description: Dark streaks painted below both eyes
Rare.compatibility_notes: Compatible with rebellious or dark-themed heads

Rare.name: Pixel Flicker Eyes
Rare.description: Pixelated eyes that appear mid-glitch
Rare.compatibility_notes: Only works with digital or glitch-based heads

Epic.name: Inferno Eyes
Epic.description: Eyes appear to be burning with inner flame
Epic.compatibility_notes: Ideal for Flame Skull or Ember heads

Epic.name: X-Ray Gaze
Epic.description: Pale cyan eyes with a glowing x-ray effect around them
Epic.compatibility_notes: Use only with transparent or mecha domes

Epic.name: Third Eye
Epic.description: Extra glowing eye in the forehead

Epic.name: Barcode Eyes
Epic.description: Vertical barcode patterns in place of pupils
Epic.compatibility_notes: Works best on tech-head or sticker-style domes

Epic.name: Starburst Glow
Epic.description: Bright eyes with star-shaped glow trails
Epic.compatibility_notes: Pairs with high-contrast heads or regal masks

Epic.name: Cracked Neon Visor
Epic.description: Broken full-visor eye piece with animated neon cracks

Epic.name: Asymmetric Blink
Epic.description: One eye squinted, other glowing fully
Epic.compatibility_notes: Best on angled or tilted characters

Epic.name: Electric Circuit Eyes
Epic.description: Electric nodes radiate out from glowing eyes
Epic.compatibility_notes: Pairs with mecha or chrome head variants

Epic.name: Flame Tear Eyes
Epic.description: Eyes leaking tiny orange-blue flame trails
Epic.compatibility_notes: Best with elemental heads or dark backgrounds

Epic.name: Glowing Thread
Epic.description: Thin, glowing strings stretch from one eye to the edge of the head
Epic.compatibility_notes: Only for clean and flat head types

Legendary.name: Glitch Rift Eyes
Legendary.description: Eyes flicker with digital distortion, like fractured data streams.
Legendary.compatibility_notes: Use with glitch, hologram, or pixel-based heads.

Legendary.name: Burn Line Gaze
Legendary.description: Eyes surrounded by burnt heat lines trailing outward.
Legendary.compatibility_notes: Works best with elemental or cracked dome heads.

Legendary.name: Electric Vein Eyes
Legendary.description: Vein-like energy trails extend from glowing eyes across the face.
Legendary.compatibility_notes: Compatible with exposed or maskless head types.

Legendary.name: Vortex Pupils
Legendary.description: Swirling spirals draw attention into the center of each eye.
Legendary.compatibility_notes: Pairs well with mystic or mind-bending characters.

Legendary.name: Flickering Sigils
Legendary.description: Runes flash inside glowing sockets with pulse-like animation.
Legendary.compatibility_notes: Use only on clean, unobstructed head shapes.

Legendary.name: Vertical Glyph Eyes
Legendary.description: Eyes resemble vertical language glyphs, softly illuminated.
Legendary.compatibility_notes: Ideal for heads with Vertical sigils or lore traits.

Legendary.name: Chrome Reflection
Legendary.description: Reflective lenses showing distorted cityscapes in their surface.
Legendary.compatibility_notes: Best on tech domes or futuristic masks.

Legendary.name: Fracture Blink
Legendary.description: Blinking causes shattering light animation across the face.

Legendary.name: Aura Lenses
Legendary.description: Lens-like eyes constantly shift hue based on surrounding aura.
Legendary.compatibility_notes: Great with reactive auras or chromatic backgrounds.

Legendary.name: Backlit Hollow Eyes
Legendary.description: Eyes glow from deep within empty sockets, backlighting the skull.
Legendary.compatibility_notes: Only compatible with skull-type or hollow heads.

Mythical.name: Star Core Vision
Mythical.description: Eyes resemble miniature galaxies, spinning slowly with stardust trails.
Mythical.compatibility_notes: Works best on heads with dark or transparent shells.

Mythical.name: Singularity Eyes
Mythical.description: Eyes are pitch black with subtle lensing, distorting space around them.
Mythical.compatibility_notes: Ideal for black hole or void-themed heads.

Mythical.name: Golden Ratio
Mythical.description: Eyes shaped in spirals of divine geometry, glowing gold.
Mythical.compatibility_notes: Use with elevated or divine-themed characters.

Mythical.name: Crowned Sparks
Mythical.description: Each eye emits an upward flicker like a spark crown.
Mythical.compatibility_notes: Compatible with regal or ascendant head types.

Mythical.name: Infinity Glare
Mythical.description: Eyes shaped like sideways infinity symbols pulsing with light.
Mythical.compatibility_notes: Best with ascendant flame or glitch auras.

Mythical.name: Warden Symbols
Mythical.description: Each eye holds a complex symbol representing an ancient force.
Mythical.compatibility_notes: Use only with lore-rich, clean domes.

Mythical.name: Time-Lapse Eyes
Mythical.description: Eyes show frames of time passing—glitch trails of previous blinks.
Mythical.compatibility_notes: Avoid pairing with fast-glitching heads.

Mythical.name: Seraphic Lens
Mythical.description: Crystal-like lenses refract light into halo rings.
Mythical.compatibility_notes: Great with floating halo or radiant dome types.

Mythical.name: Eclipse Eyes
Mythical.description: Eyes with bright rims and fully black centers — like solar eclipses.
Mythical.compatibility_notes: Use with Mythical backgrounds or Eclipse head types.

Mythical.name: Vertical Prime Glyphs
Mythical.description: Eyes display pulsing golden runes from the Vertical Core.
Mythical.compatibility_notes: Only compatible with the ‘Vertical Prime’ head type.
